medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe hepatotoxicity associated with rifampin-pyrazinamide therapy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was asymptomatic until 19 August 2002, when he began complaining of fatigue, nausea, and myalgias. Symptoms started after 42 doses of rifampin-pyrazinamide over 59 days. Liver enzyme levels became elevated significantly, reaching 1757 U/L on 19 August and escalating before the patient was admitted to the hospital on 26 August 2002.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of gastroplasty for weight loss.
medical_history.social_history: The patient consumed 1 drink of alcohol every 2-3 months and worked as a clerk in an inner-city agency.
